veneeene CE MC. NO-7067 OF 2014
Dated this the 5" day of January, 2015
ORDER
This is a petition filed under Section 482 of the
Code of Criminal Procedure.

2. Petitioners are accused Nos.1 to 4 in Crime
No.382/2014 of Mararikkulam Police Station registered for
the offences punishable under Sections 498A and 406 read
with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code.

3. Petitioners have come up with this petition for
getting Annexure-A2 final report in Crime No.382/2014 of
Mararikkulam Police Station as against the petitioners and
all further proceedings based on it in C.C.2030/2014
pending before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l,
Alappuzha, quashed.

4. The allegation against the petitioners is that they
have tortured and harassed the de facto complainant, who
is the wife of the 1* petitioner, and treated her with cruelty
within the meaning of Section 498A IPC, by demanding
more dowry after misappropriating her entire gold

BRE
2015/KER/36
Crl.M.C.7067/2014 oe
ornaments and money,

5. Heard learned counsel for the petitioners, the
learned counsel for the defacto complainant, who is the 2"
respondent herein, and learned Public Prosecutor.

6. According to the petitioners, all the matters in
dispute between the petitioners and the defacto complainant
have been amicably settled and presently, the defacto
complainant has no complaints against the petitioners and,
therefore, the proceedings against the petitioners may be
quashed.

7. The defacto complainant, who is the 2"
respondent herein, has filed an affidavit affirming that all the
matiers in dispute between her and the petitioners have
been amicably settled and, therefore, she has no complaints
against the petitioners and, therefore, all further
proceedings in the matter referred to above can be
quashed. She has entered appearance through her
counsel. The learned counsel for the defacto complainant

Beal
2015/KER/36
Crl.M.C.7067/2014 uae
also endorses the fact that the affidavit has been sworn in
by the defacto complainant on her own volition.
8. When all the matrimonial disputes have been
setiled between the parties and as the defacto complainant
has no complaints against the petitioners, it is only just and
expedient in the interest of justice to quash the proceedings
referred to above.
In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A2
final report in Crime No.382/2014 of Mararikkulam Police
Station as against the petitioners and all further proceedings
based on it in C.C.2030/2014 pending before the Judicial
First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Alappuzha are hereby
quashed.
Sd/-
(B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE)
aks/05/01
